dialogue.text: As I jumped, gusts of wind rushed into my face.
It was difficult to keep my mouth closed.
That was the last thing I had time to think about…
Not like bells, but as if someone had smashed my mother's vase right inside my head.
I couldn't feel my legs. I couldn't feel anything.
Only the ground was very cold and very hard beneath me.
I know how to breathe, I've done it a million times!
And then... I didn't even have time to understand why I couldn't breathe…
Suddenly, I felt the Fairy's fingers clamp down on my jaw.
I barely had time to blink.
That fat fairy uncle with tiny wings just pulled out my teeth!
I saw them in his hand.
Without saying a word to me, he flew away.
I only heard the fluttering of his stupid wings as he disappeared overhead...
